main event: Lights were seen in the sky near Rapid City, South Dakota in March 1957. The lights changed color (white, blue, and red) and appeared to be rotating and moving slowly.
interesting points: The lights seemed to have a reflection pattern slanting outward from them.
There was a cloud layer above the layer where the lights were observed.
The object was observed for around 20 minutes before disappearing.
The lights appeared to be traveling at a rapid rate and changing in size or brightness.
The report notes that the sighting was excessive for Rapid City and possibly an astronomical display, but the data was incomplete for a full analysis.
sighted object: Lights in the sky that changed color and appeared to be rotating
witnesses: Military personnel, including Capt. Thomas J. O'Hara
photographs: No photographs included in the report
